author: Special Correspondent
text:
Of the over 300 complaints received by the Election Commission since the announcement of the schedule for the May 16 Assembly polls, about 50 per cent of them allege violation of Model Code of Conduct (MCC).

“Since the day of announcement on March 4, we have received over 300 complaints and over 50 per cent of the complaints received are about the violations of Model Code of Conduct. Our officials are looking into the complaints and taking action,” Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni said on Sunday.

Replying to a query, he said the complaints alleging violations of Model Code were mostly about non removal of banners of political parties. The Commission has also received visual complaints from the public showing the place where the violation has taken place and how.

Meanwhile, batches of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) with provisions for Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) system – a facility through which voters can be assured that the vote they cast has been accounted to the intended candidate or NOTA, arrived in various parts of Chennai on Sunday.

“The requirement is about 79,000 EVMs for 234 Assembly constituencies across the State. The VVPAT equipment required for constituency in Chennai arrived on Sunday,” he said.

‘Since the day of announcement on March 4, we have received over 300 complaints’
title: Over 50% of complaints allege code violation
